channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Why Europe's fight against the pandemic is about to get much more dangerous
Beijing Winter Olympics 2022
Coronavirus
Cryptocurrency
item.description: Everything you need to know about bitcoin, blockchain, NFTs and more. Plus, the latest cryptocurrency news, interviews and investing guides.

item.title: Russia
item.description: View the latest Russia news and videos, including politics and business headlines.

item.title: Japan
item.description: View the latest Japan news and videos, including politics, travel and style headlines.

item.title: Are cell phone calls on airplane flights inevitable?
item.description: Ah, holiday travel. Between huge crowds and weather delays, flying during this time of year is hectic. Now close your eyes and imagine the entire scenario with one additional annoyance: Loud talkers yammering into their cell phones at 35,000 feet.

item.title: 'Hamlet' in the skies? The story behind Taiwan's newest airline
item.description: Debuting its first flights in January 2020, Taiwanese start-up STARLUX Airlines could be the first new player in 30 years to upend the island's duopoly aviation market.

item.title: Copenhagen's new Metro is a thing of beauty
item.description: In Copenhagen, traffic is usually caused by the two-wheel variety of transportation: the bicycle.

item.title: The hotel designed for likes
The best luxury bars in Budapest
Budapest 's fine dining revolution
Luxury atop one of the world's tallest hotels
item.description: From traditional souks, mosques and UNESCO World Heritage sites, to futuristic skyscrapers, Baku, capital of Azerbaijan, offers an eclectic mix of old and new.

item.title: They say he lived to be 168. Here's how
item.description: There are a number of destinations around the world famed for the longevity of their residents.

item.title: This fire has been burning for 4,000 years
item.description: "This fire has burned 4,000 years and never stopped," says Aliyeva Rahila. "Even the rain coming here, snow, wind -- it never stops burning."

item.title: Russia says it's withdrawing some troops following exercises around Ukraine, but major drills continue
item.description: Russia announced Tuesday that some of its troops would return to base after completing recent drills, but stressed that other major military exercises would continue.

item.title: Videos show Russian units and missiles advancing toward Ukraine border
item.description: The build-up of Russian forces close to the Ukrainian border continues apace, with everything from submarines and amphibious landing ships in the Black Sea to short-range ballistic missiles, tanks and howitzers around Ukraine's northeastern edges.

item.title: The latest on the Ukraine-Russia border crisis
item.description: US officials believe Russia could launch an invasion of Ukraine this week but are still holding out hope that diplomacy can prevail. Follow here for the latest news updates here.

item.title: Russia has surrounded Ukraine on three sides. Here's where an invasion could be launched
item.description: Russia has amassed more than 100,000 troops near Ukraine's border in recent weeks, according to US estimates, raising fears from Western and Ukrainian intelligence officials that an invasion could be imminent.

item.title: Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall has tested positive for Covid-19, Clarence House said on Monday, four days after her husband Prince Charles was revealed to have contracted the virus.

item.title: The West is a player in the Ukraine information war. Unlike Russia, it has to convince the public
item.description: Corpses strewn through wrecked buildings in the aftermath of an apparently deadly explosion. Distraught mourners, grieving for lost loved ones. And amid the smoldering ruins, evidence of Western military equipment.

item.title: The latest on Ukraine and Russia tensions
item.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said that "no one should be surprised" if Russia instigates a provocation which it then uses to justify military action in Ukraine. Follow here for the latest news.

item.title: 'Freedom Convoy' protesters enter Paris and block traffic before they're dispersed with tear gas
item.description: Protesters in a so-called "Freedom Convoy" made it past police checkpoints in central Paris on Saturday, with demonstrators completely blocking traffic in the French capital before they were met with tear gas fired by officers.

item.title: Floor collapses at London bar, leaving 13 injured
item.description: A mezzanine floor collapsed at a bar in east London on Saturday, leaving more than a dozen people injured.

item.title: The latest on Ukraine and Russia tensions
item.description: Tensions between Moscow and Kyiv are at their highest in years, with a large Russian troop buildup near the shared borders of the two former Soviet republics. Follow here for the latest news.

item.title: Russia may be on the brink of war. In Moscow, you might not know it
item.description: Read most headlines coming out of the West around Ukraine, and the situation looks dire. In Russia it feels different, at least as far as the public discussion goes.
The Ukrainian village of Trokhizbenka used to be a weekend getaway destination, a relaxing place where urban dwellers could travel to take in some fresh forest air.

item.title: The latest on Ukraine and Russia tensions
item.description: Tensions between Moscow and Kyiv are at their highest in years, with a large Russian troop buildup near the shared borders of the two former Soviet republics. Follow for live news updates.

item.title: New satellite images show continuing Russian military buildup on three sides of Ukraine
item.description: New satellite images released by a US-based technology company appear to show continuing Russian military buildup in Crimea, western Russia and Belarus, as pressure continues to mount on Ukraine from three directions, underscoring fears that the Kremlin is planning an incursion into Ukrainian territory.
